body.name: His Maker's Mark: A Standalone Paranormal Romance Novella

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars His Maker’s Mark
reviews.reviewText: His Maker’s Mark by Kristen PainterParanormal romance novella.Annaleigh Barlow was hoping to save the historical building where her grandfather did the stone masonry work. Unfortunately, it’s been scheduled for destruction so she spends time on the upper outdoor observatory, taking as many photos as possible of the single remaining gargoyle and the stone work.On one of the last nights before the building implodes as she’s visiting, Annaleigh is assaulted by thugs. Bleeding, she tries to climb up to the windowsills near the gargoyle but her ankle is grabbed and she’s dragged back down. She’s touched the claws of the gargoyle and pleads for any help possible.Magic happens and Annaleigh’s life changes.A fable comes to life on her behalf. Annaleigh is a bit naive, honest, hard working and alone. Vasmir will protect the lady that called him. Together they remember his maker and find happiness through his tears.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sweet Gargoyle Paranormal
reviews.reviewText: I love all the books, series, standalone, and even newsletters that Kristen Painter writes. If she writes it, I read it. Generally, I am not a big novella fan until this one; so much excitement and suspense was packed into a short time. I would have had no problem reading this story if it was longer, but it was perfect the way it was and was so good.The gargoyle story theme was brilliant, sweet, and quite dreamy. The way that they were able to overcome financial difficulties was clever. I will definitely read this story again and again.I switched between the Kindle and Audible version. Narration by BJ. Harrison is always enjoyable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great read as always!
reviews.reviewText: I have loved reading anything from Kristen. When I first heard about this book, I immediately pre-ordered it. I have to admit that I immediately thought of the old cartoon show “Gargoyles” and I see Vasmir looking like Goliath in my head. The story grabbed my attention and made me want to read it in one sitting. I didn’t expect the reveal of the “bad guy” but I thoroughly enjoyed it! Kristen is a very prolific author and I look forward to reading more of her books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Treasure tears and love.
reviews.reviewText: A heartfelt interesting quick read, just what is welcome on a lazy afternoon. This might start a new minis series from a wonderful writer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This will make you smile!
reviews.reviewText: When Kristen announced this surprise novella in her newsletter, I immediately pre-ordered. All of the things that make Nocturne Falls and Shadowvale pleasant escapes are here. It was a lovely Valentine gift to myself.Interestingly, Annaleigh is a bit dense but very kind hearted and overly trusting. Her lack of forethought is the reason that I rate this at a 4.5 stars rounded up to a full 5. Typically our KP ladies are a bit…um smarter? Annaleigh comes across like someone you’d have to help navigate life. I think it is fortunate that she finds Vasmir so they can guide each other.As always, there are other surprises that are woven into the story to keep the reader from guessing too much and Vasim is such a sweet and unexpected hero that he makes up for the Annaleigh eye rolls. I definitely recommend this! You will have a smile on your face for hours after reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Such a good novella
reviews.reviewText: I loved it from beginning to end. It was a quick read and didn't seem to be slow at any point. I'd definitely recommend this book to those that love the Paranormal and Fantasy. Vasmir was more knowledgeable about certain things than I thought he initially would be. I loved the certain detail to a few of the smaller things. I can't go into more detail about them without giving away too much. But things that I thought were later answered in the book. Great job Kristen! I hope to read more about both charaters in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing as always!!!
reviews.reviewText: What a great read!! I love EVERYTHING that Kristen Painter writes and of course this is not any different. Annaleigh is desperately trying to save a building that her grandfather did the stone work for. While taking pictures to preserve as much memories as possible she is brutally attacked. She begs for help, in doing so she has awoken Vasmir. I hope this starts a small mini series for these 2. I cannot wait to listen to the audiobook as well. PLease keep these little surprise books coming!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice little stand alone novella
reviews.reviewText: This is an engaging and entertaining stand alone PNR short story. The two main characters are interesting and likeable and the there's an interesting little plot going on. I read it easily over the course of two days and would've been quite happy for it to have been a full length novel as I felt the characters and story had a lot going for them, so I'd have no complaints if Kristen decided to revisit them in the future 🙂
